intro: Hypoestes perrieri, commonly known as the "Snowflake" plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble tiny snowflakes. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is typically lance-shaped and has a slightly hairy texture. Hypoestes perrieri is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental flowers and compact growth habit.
